meanings.definition: A hair accessory consisting of a fabric-covered elastic band
meanings.sent1: I wore a scrunchie in my hair to keep it up during dance class.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new scrunchie to match her outfit for the party.
meanings.sent3: The scrunchie slipped off her wrist and landed in her soup, making her laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was a wild mess until she put a scrunchie in, taming it like magic.
meanings.sent5: The colorful scrunchie sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: To gather or contract into wrinkles or folds
meanings.sent1: I had to scrunchie the fabric to make it fit into the small box.
meanings.sent2: She would scrunchie her nose whenever she smelled something unpleasant.
meanings.sent3: The cat would scrunchie up its body to fit into the tiny box, looking quite silly.
meanings.sent4: The old letter was scrunchied up in a ball, forgotten in the back of the drawer.
meanings.sent5: The leaves would scrunchie together in the wind, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: To make a crunching or scrunching noise
meanings.sent1: As she walked on the snow, it would scrunchie under her boots.
meanings.sent2: The paper scrunchied loudly as she crumpled it up in frustration.
meanings.sent3: The chips would scrunchie in his mouth as he enjoyed the salty snack.
meanings.sent4: The dry leaves scrunchied as she stepped on them, announcing her presence.
meanings.sent5: The gravel scrunchied under the weight of the car as it drove down the driveway.
